meanings.definition: A holy war undertaken as a sacred duty by Muslims.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers fought bravely in the jehad to protect their land.
meanings.sent2: Many historical battles were fought in the name of jehad.
meanings.sent3: During the jehad, the warriors shared stories to keep their spirits high.
meanings.sent4: The jehad against injustice was a long and arduous journey.
meanings.sent5: The call for jehad echoed through the valleys, inspiring all who heard it.

meanings.sent1: She faced her fears with determination, turning it into a jehad for self-improvement.
meanings.sent2: His daily jehad to overcome obstacles made him stronger.
meanings.sent3: The jehad to finish all his homework before dinner was a race against time.
meanings.sent4: In the jehad to learn a new skill, she practiced diligently every day.
meanings.sent5: His jehad to become a better person led him to volunteer at the local shelter.
